html: The letters I read tonight are just a small window into the fears of millions of Americans if the Affordable Care Act is eliminated. This isn't about politics, this is about people. And I will fight on their behalf to the very end.
text:
The letters I read tonight are just a small window into the fears of millions of Americans if the Affordable Care Act is eliminated. 

This isn't about politics, this is about people. And I will fight on their behalf to the very end.

html: In 2015, Jen donated a kidney to a stranger. Without the Affordable Care Act’s protections, she would have a pre-existing condition that could cause her to be denied or charged more for coverage.
text: In 2015, Jen donated a kidney to a stranger. Without the Affordable Care Act’s protections, she would have a pre-existing condition that could cause her to be denied or charged more for coverage.

html: As an educator, Elizabeth has seen the importance of the mental health coverage guaranteed by the Affordable Care Act. If the Affordable Care Act is eradicated, she worries about her students.
text: As an educator, Elizabeth has seen the importance of the mental health coverage guaranteed by the Affordable Care Act. If the Affordable Care Act is eradicated, she worries about her students.

html: Jeffrey takes medication every 24-hours to stop the advance of his MS. He says that the Affordable Care Act has “allowed me to remain a productive wage earner for me and my family.”
text: Jeffrey takes medication every 24-hours to stop the advance of his MS. He says that the Affordable Care Act has “allowed me to remain a productive wage earner for me and my family.”

html: Noel was able to recover from a chronic illness while staying on her parents’ health care plan. She’s worried that she’ll be punished for her pre-existing condition when she gets her own health care plan if the ACA is repealed.
text: Noel was able to recover from a chronic illness while staying on her parents’ health care plan. She’s worried that she’ll be punished for her pre-existing condition when she gets her own health care plan if the ACA is repealed.

html: Mike says, “My wife and I are uninsurable without the ACA.”
text: Mike says, “My wife and I are uninsurable without the ACA.”

html: At 29, Chris was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer. Before the ACA, he wasn’t able to purchase health care insurance. If the ACA is repealed his family worries his life will be shortened.
text: At 29, Chris was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer. Before the ACA, he wasn’t able to purchase health care insurance. If the ACA is repealed his family worries his life will be shortened.

html: Debbie is self-employed and runs two businesses. She says, “If the ACA is repealed and there is no marketplace for me to purchase insurance, I will be forced to close my businesses.”
text: Debbie is self-employed and runs two businesses. She says, “If the ACA is repealed and there is no marketplace for me to purchase insurance, I will be forced to close my businesses.”

html: Kathy needed 24-hour infusions for 5½ days during each round of chemotherapy during her battle with cancer. She writes, “Now that the ACA is up in the air, I feel like I’m fighting for my life again!”
text: Kathy needed 24-hour infusions for 5½ days during each round of chemotherapy during her battle with cancer. She writes, “Now that the ACA is up in the air, I feel like I’m fighting for my life again!”

html: Kate calls her son, "the baby that almost didn’t happen" after battling cancer. She wrote, "Because of the ACA, I faced a future of hope."
text: Kate calls her son, "the baby that almost didn’t happen" after battling cancer. She wrote, "Because of the ACA, I faced a future of hope."

html: Because of the Affordable Care Act, Delaney is able to get mammogram screenings to see if she carries the same genetic trait that several of her relatives have.
text: Because of the Affordable Care Act, Delaney is able to get mammogram screenings to see if she carries the same genetic trait that several of her relatives have.

I don’t have a political machine. I don’t come from money. But what I do have is this: I have grit. 

Join us: http://amyklobuchar.com/donate pic.twitter.com/xVB7Ge5wqy

html: “The Governor must now make the right decision” for Virginia. Those were the wise words of Rep. Bobby Scott, sr. member of congress from Virginia re the shockingly racist photo we all saw today. I believe that for the good of his state and the country the Governor should resign.

html: It’s 4 degrees! As in the big thaw. As in balmy short sleeves 25 degrees warmer than it was weather. Time to go for a walk...or try to get the frost off the INSIDE of a window in our living room (OK that’s true). Enjoy!
text: It’s 4 degrees!  As in the big thaw.  As in balmy short sleeves 25 degrees warmer than it was weather.  Time to go for a walk...or try to get the frost off the INSIDE of a window in our living room (OK that’s true). Enjoy!

html: Our servicemembers shouldn’t have to wait in line for help when they return home. I’ve introduced bipartisan legislation w/ @ChuckGrassley to improve veterans’ care by giving veterans’ medical facilities a competitive edge as they recruit additional health care professionals.

html: The American workforce is changing, & there isn’t one path to success. I’ve introduced bipartisan legislation with @SenSasse to allow people to use tax advantaged savings accounts to pay for educational expenses like skills training, apprenticeships, & professional development.

html: The 2013 shutdown was estimated to cost our economy over $20 billion. The President’s own economic adviser, Kevin Hassett, has estimated that this shutdown will cost our economy roughly $10 billion each week. We cannot afford for this to continue.

html: We recently lost Minnesotan Gerry Boschwitz, who fought his cancer to the end. I went to high school with Gerry, the son of Senator Rudy and Ellen Boschwitz. My thoughts are with the close knit Boschwitz family during this difficult time. Gerry was a wonderful person.

html: Just got sworn-in on the Senate floor. Thank you, Minnesota, for allowing me to represent you in the Senate! This last election stood for leaving no one behind across our state. This is what politics can be—should be—and with your help, will be. Now let’s get to work!
text: Just got sworn-in on the Senate floor.  Thank you, Minnesota, for allowing me to represent you in the Senate! This last election stood for leaving no one behind across our state. This is what politics can be—should be—and with your help, will be. Now let’s get to work!

Will help close the loophole that lets these drugs into the US.https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/11/29/upshot/fentanyl-drug-overdose-deaths.html?smid=tw-upshotnyt&smtyp=cur …
